text: José Sarney de Araújo Costa (born 24 April 1930) is a Brazilian politician, lawyer, and writer. He was President of Brazil from 15 March 1985 to 15 March 1990. He was originally elected Vice President of Brazil with Tancredo Neves as President. However the day before the inauguration, Neves died from diverticulitis. Sarney was sworn in as Vice President of Brazil on 15 March 1985 and became president on 21 April. In July 2021, Sarney was hospitalized for pleural effusion and had surgery to remove fluid from his lungs. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:Presidents of Brazil Category:Vice presidents of Brazil Category:Presidents of the Federal Senate Category:Politicians from Maranhão
